snippet: Churches have already lost a court fight to continue to hold worship services in New York City public schools, but with a February deadline looming, they have not given up hope.
abstract: Christian congregations in New York City are holding prayer vigils in an effort to press the city into letting them continue to hold worship services in public school buildings; 16-year legal battle with the city of New York ended with an appeals court ruling banning worship services from public schools because they could imply government endorsement of a particular faith; city has announced that the ban will be effective on Feb 12.
lead_paragraph: Churches have already lost a court fight to continue to hold worship services in New York City public schools, but with a February deadline looming, they have not given up hope.

headline.seo: Churches Change Tactics to Fight Ouster From N.Y.C. Schools
headline.main: After Losing a Lawsuit, Taking Their Appeal to God
